title: Drawing, "Archbishop's Throne and Canopy; Six Separate Studies for a Throne, Prie-Dieu, and Canopy", 1808
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, white gouache, traces of black chalk, ruled border in pen and black ink on heavy white paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, at lower left:  Dessiné par Hippolitte Eqvennez en 1808: in pen and gray ink, next to each separate study (from upper left, counterclockwise): Tapis de prie-dieu;  Dessus du fauteuil; profil du fauteuil; Prie-Dieu;  Console en plafond; plafond du trône; coupe du Dôme.
dimensions:
39.9 x 53.7 cm (15 11/16 x 21 1/8 in.)
dimensions vary
Mat:  55.9 x 71.1 cm (22 x 28 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Frederick Formes Horter
description: Elevation of an elaborate throne and canopy at the center, rendered in full color; side elevation of canopy, in line, right.  Side elevation of throne and other details, in line, left.  The canopy is composed of a flat dome, supported at rear by Ionic pilasters, unsupported at front.  Dome surmounted by cross and plumes.  Drapery behind it, bearing design of ecclesiastical motifs, a panel of the Lamb of God, directly above throne.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Archbishop's Throne and Canopy; Six Separate Studies for a Throne, Prie-Dieu, and Canopy", 1808.
1808. Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, white gouache, traces of black chalk, ruled border in pen and black ink on heavy white paper. Museum purchase through gift of Frederick Formes Horter. 1949-61-7.
